poem:
### El Fasher

In the quiet 
of morning's light,   
dust settles like whispers  
where once there was life—  
El Fasher's streets  
echo footfalls of sorrow,  
a city's breath  
held in siege's embrace,  
faces turned  
toward a fractured sky—  
hope tethered to  
the edge of breaking.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sudan’s brutal civil war – what has happened in El Fasher? Another devastating chapter in Sudan’s brutal civil war has taken place as the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces captured El Fasher from the army after an 18-month siege that trapped tens of thousands of civilians in the city in Darfur. The RSF now controls all major urban centres in Darfur, a development that raises the possibility the country could face partition. Interactive What has happened". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
